title: Augmented Reality-Based Science Learning Optimization Design: Application of Latent Profile Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Science Concepts and Mobile Device Usage Experience
context.additional_context: Learners access augmented reality (AR) content solely via smartphones, with an emphasis on self-directed learning and analysis of learning patterns.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze their cognitive load profiles during AR-based science learning activities and establish effective learning strategies

Learners analyze ≥3 social phenomena (e.g., climate change, urban planning) linked to scientific concepts (e.g., thermodynamics laws, ecosystem balance) using AR simulation tools (e.g., GeoGebra AR, Climate Time Machine). They submit inquiry reports achieving ≥level 4 on a 5-level rubric (conceptual accuracy, analytical depth, creativity, applicability, clarity of expression)
Learners enhance self-regulated learning abilities based on behavioral patterns observed during AR learning processes

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
